title: Crashing after client closes post champion select
body: See title. I don't play on windows 10.

replies.body: It seems that turning off the *Wait for Vertical Sync* setting causes these crashes. Any ideas on how to fix this? If not, I think my computer can handle league fine to warrent keeping it ticked.
Testing with a few things right now. It seems that tuning my settings to certain sets causes the crashing. Working on figuring out what settings do this.

I play on a home computer, pc, whatever you want to call it. As soon as the champion select ends, and the client minimizes (I don't need it to close because usually my pc can handle it), and the game opens. Before I can see anything in the loading screen, my monitor cuts to black, and in order to continue using my pc, I have to restart it. Alt-tabbing, using the windows key, ctrl-alt-delete, nothing gets it to fix itself. I don't get any errors. I play on Windows 7 if it matters.

Thanks for the info here, it helps a lot!  This sounds like a driver our hardware could be failing, or maybe a resolution problem failing to render on your screen properly.  This can't be a connection issue, though, because it would need to be more severe to make your pc freeze like that.  My suggestion here would be to run through each step of the [game crash](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes+) guide to troubleshoot towards a fix.

Just in case, a config reset might help as well if the resolution is contributing to the problem.

Log into the game client.
Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
Go into a custom game and verify that settings have saved properly.  Leave game to sync settings. 

Test it out in a custom game and let me know if those steps work for you.
What are you playing on?  I want to help but could use just a little more info.  What do you mean exactly by crash?  For example, are you getting any error messages?
